sub_title: Scientist, creator & writer | Science communicator | Spiderwoman, PhD | Product Person | TEDx Speaker
summary:
Product person by day, science writing ninja by night and spiderwoman somewhere in between: Lučka is an irredeemable nerd interested in science and tech in all its forms. Ex-academic, founder, radio producer, writer, and pharmacist. Now, a head of article pipeline management for Springer Nature to help academics publish quicker. User focused and data driven. A Slovenian native, Lučka is a lover of long runs, mountains, coffee, and VR games, currently residing in the Netherlands, most likely multitasking. Say hello if any of that sparks a big idea. 

More info:
👩🏼‍🔬 Co-author of 15+ peer-reviewed articles in internationally renowned journals, 50+ science communication pieces published in the journals such as Nature Chemistry and JACS, and an article on authenthic leadership in Science.
🎙 Former science writer and media producer at the BBC’s Naked Scientists at the University of Cambridge, reaching an audience of 1M+ with 100K+ downloads.
✍🏻 Former science writer for the American Chemical Society. 
💡 Founder of Bug Off Pain© and co-founder of CryoThaw.
👩‍💻 Creator of the VR game for public engagement and science education. 
🏆 UK National Entrepreneurship Biotechnology 2017 Winner. Internationally recognised as CAS Future Leader 2018. Global Lindau Nobel Laureate Meeting 2020 Award. 
🔈TEDx Speaker 2021 on How Gamers are Solving Science’s Biggest Problems. 
🤝 Mentoring in science communication, career development and team leadership

awards.title: TEDx Speaker
awards.description:
In the talk, How gamers are solving science’s biggest problems, I discuss the power of VR games in solving science problems, ranging from researching Alzheimer’s disease to helping surgeons perform hard operations.

More info:
• https://biodtp.norwichresearchpark.ac.uk/news/nrpdtp-alumna-lucka-bibic-participates-in-tedx-krsko-as-a-tedx-speaker/
• https://www.ted.com/tedx/events/39620
• https://youtu.be/WAIfgB2d9Xs

awards.title: International 70th Lindau Nobel Laureate Meeting Honour
awards.description:
Internationally selected as a participant in the 70th Lindau Nobel Laureate Meeting in Lindau, Germany in 2020 (due to Covid, postponed to 2022).

Only the 650 most qualified applicants are given the opportunity to enrich and share the unique atmosphere of these meetings. The selected young scientists are all under the age of 35 and go through an extensive international selection process. The prestigious meeting of minds will concentrate on the fields of medicine, physics, chemistry and physiology, with an emphasis on interdisciplinary research.

More info:
https://www.lindau-nobel.org/blog-virtual-lab-simulations/

awards.title: National BioTech YES2017 Entrepreneurship Award (UK)
awards.description:
A 6-months entrepreneurship training for postgraduate and postdoctoral scholars that are provided with business training and mentorship to enable them to operate scientifically viable businesses. The training ends with a national YES competition.

Overall national BioTech YES2017 winners. Award for the best start-up business plan, and the people’s choice award. Sharing the award with the CryoThaw team as their CEO.

projects.title: Influence of popular drinks on the effectiveness of medicines [Vpliv priljubljenih pijač na učinkovitost zdravil]
projects.description:
Summary

When the ingested tablet with the contained active ingredient come to stomach, dissolving of active ingredient starts; which, beside absorption in the gastrointestinal tract, presents a major impact on drugs efficiency. 
Releasing and dissolving of active ingredient has an effect on changing pH in our stomach. We were interested how drinks that are popular between the youngsters nowadays, influence both of the above mentioned processes. 
We chose four different drinks (homemade wine, Coca-Cola, juice and tap water and two different media – simulated gastric fluid and 0, 01 M HCl ) and to release of paracetamol, ciprofloxacin and norfloxacin was investigated. These three active ingredients, which were in the pharmaceutical forms of the tablets were added to the dissolution vessels that contained the medium and drink and the temperature was held in specified limits. 
With that we tried to simulate the biological conditions in stomach. 
Also, we use tap water, as a medium to see how an active ingredient would behave, if we had only water in our stomach, instead of gastric juice.
Results showed that the type of a drink influences the amount and the rate of release of the active ingredient and has influences pH of media, although not significantly. The highest influence of drinks on dissolution was observed with norfloxacine and the smallest with ciprofloxacine, regardless of what kind of media we used, 
Norfloxacine showed the greatest influence on pH profile of media and the paracetamol had the smallest effect.

projects.title: Virtual reality game: Bug off Pain
projects.description:
The virtual reality (VR) Game “Bug Off Pain” is based on the idea of using spider venom toxins to make better painkillers for the future, with VR being used as an innovative approach to science communication and public engagement.
 
Bug Off Pain is an immersive and educational VR experience that places the viewer inside the brain and shows them first-hand the molecular system in our brains that allows us to sense pain. The game consists of two parts; first, it teaches you about what you see in the brain (regarding the different cell functions and the proteins in these cells that are crucial in pain pharmacology). Then the experience gets even better when the spiders start crawling, injecting their venom and you can choose, by trial and error, which spider venom is capable to shut down the pain and which is not. More blocking, more points for you! The experience ends after you’ve found a perfect venom which blocks one specific protein and results in "pain over".
 
The game was launched on Halloween weekend, the 27th of October 2017, as one of the main attractions of Norwich Science Festival. Bug Off Pain had been launched on two different platforms; high-end Oculus Rift and its cheaper version "Google Cardboard" (scan the QR code via www.bugoffpain.com) which allows you to play Bug Off Pain straight from your sofa at home.
 
We hope you would find our VR game "Bug Off Pain" to be an engaging way of learning about science and can be used for broader science communication, education and teaching.

Authors: Lucka Bibic, Justinas Druskis, Samuel Walpole, Jesus Angulo, Leanne Stokes.
Project leader: Lucka Bibic
© 2017 University of East Anglia. All Rights Reserved

https://youtu.be/lSnyKxZPLh0
https://www.uea.ac.uk/pharmacy/research/bug-off-pain
https://www.uea.ac.uk/about/-/powers-of-spider-venom-explored-in-vr-game

authors.headline: Scientist, creator & writer | Science communicator | Spiderwoman, PhD | Product Person | TEDx Speaker

profile_positions.description:
Labster is a fast-moving, award-winning Ed-Tech company that focuses on revolutionizing the way science is taught to students all over the world.

Responsibilities: driving content performance with catalogue excellence product team, managing product discovery to enhance existing products, defining and maintaining the product catalogue vision and strategy, prioritizing roadmap, and grooming backlog.
profile_positions.title: Senior Product Manager

profile_positions.description:
American Chemical Society (ACS) is one of the world’s largest scientific organizations and one of the world’s leading sources of authoritative scientific information.

Responsibilities: writing JACS Spotlights, contributing to ACS editorials and consulting for the Journal of Chemical Education (gamification in education, public engagement, virtual reality games in education, educational software apps and serious gaming).
profile_positions.title: Senior Science Writer

profile_positions.description: Leading the execution of scientific content development for the digital product and strategic workflow improvements to improve circle times. Managing a team of 15+ members and reporting directly to the COO.
profile_positions.title: Product Owner

profile_positions.description: Team lead, co-founder and CEO of CryoThaw - winners of the national entrepreneurship competition, called Biotechnology YES2017, for the Best Start-up Plan. Further, the team took home the People’s Choice Award (Royal Society of London, Dec 2017). Led a team of four Ph.D. Researchers with no prior business background. The idea was originally pitched to the venture capitalists at the GlaxoSmithKline (UK) in October 2017. Licensed out in 2020.
profile_positions.title: Co-founder & CEO - CryoThaw

profile_positions.description: Project lead and budget-holder of the VR game on my doctoral research, called Bug Off Pain© as a novel approach to science communication and public engagement (launched at the Norwich Science Festival, Oct 2017). Led a multidisciplinary team of four (2 students, 2 seniors), and partnered with the Forum (Norwich, UK) to feature Bug Off Pain at the various festivals across the UK. Our work was later published in J Chem Edu (ACS), featured in various national newsletters and continuously used as a teaching aid.
profile_positions.title: Founder & Project Lead - Bug Off Pain

profile_positions.description: Studied how the spider venom toxins might be used as the next painkillers to treat chronic pain. Presented at 10+ scientific conferences, including international symposiums (UK, USA, IT, Brazil) with 500+ audiences. Published 15+ academic papers in renowned journals and 25+ other articles.
profile_positions.title: PhD Researcher

profile_positions.description: Organized and lead professional and personal development accredited science communication workshops at the Faculty of Science. Supervised several Masters and undergraduate students on various projects at the School of Pharmacy and the School of Computing Sciences.
profile_positions.title: Teaching Associate

profile_positions.description: Assisting in the two lab-based internships within medicinal and peptide chemistry
profile_positions.title: Research Assistant

profile_positions.description:
BBSRC Professional Internship Scheme (PIPS) at the Naked Scientists - an award winning BBC weekly science-based radio programme based at the University of Cambridge who broadcast over BBC and ABC (Australia). The aim is to strip science down to its bare essentials and make it available to the public. 

Outcome (as paraphrased by https://www.uea.ac.uk/community-university-engagement/awards): 
"Lucka’s internship at Naked Scientist resulted in ten written news stories, 15 podcasts and the production of a one hour Naked Scientist radio show ‘Animation: The Reel Deal’ which was broadcast on BBC5 ‘Live Science’ and ABC Australia, reaching an audience of more than 1 million worldwide.  Her podcasts feature interviews with an impressive array of professionals including researchers from MIT, Harvard University, KU Leven Belgium and TV- celebrity from the Big Bang Theory Dr Mayim Bailik. With over 100K downloads, the podcasts cover topics ranging from gin distilling, earth science, electronic noses, linguistics, odontology, digestion, cancer, and solar flight."
profile_positions.title: Science Communicator

profile_positions.description: Providing assistance in the Department of Microbiological Quality Control and Department of Pharmacetical Research&Development (summers 2010-2011)
profile_positions.title: Research assistant (industrial R&D)
